greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Replace each digit d (except the leading one) of n with 9-d.
comment: By definition, one-digit numbers do not change.
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: a(n) = n if n < 10, otherwise 2*a(floor(n/2)) + 9 - n mod 10; a self-inverse permutation of the natural numbers, A115310(n+8, 9) = a(n) for n > 0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 20 2006
results.author: _Zak Seidov_, May 12 2005
